update.description: Here, the simspark NAO model (Type Zero) and its controller are ready. This pull request suggests that this model is merged with the rest of the codes. It uses the PID controller and simulator controls robots joints position based on RoboCup agents commands (Target joints Velocity). I could walk this robot with speed around 25 cm/s. In order to access the agent binary that can walk, please use this [link](https://feupload.fe.up.pt/get/aeluLuz1daE5DcK). The behavior of this agent in both Simspark and Gazebo should be similar.
update.title: Modeling of simspark NAO robot and its Controller

pull_request.title: Modeling of simspark NAO robot and its Controller

update.description:
Here, the simspark NAO model (Type Zero) and its controller are ready. This pull request suggests that this model is merged with the rest of the codes. It uses the PID controller and simulator controls robots joints position based on RoboCup agents commands (Target joints Velocity). I could walk this robot with very low speed. The specification of this model can be found in this [link](http://simspark.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Models).
It should be noted that it is better to use the recent developed agent class that has been implemented for issue #9. I suggest to have a position control for Aldebaran NAO, which I have already implemented that in fc620a7. The controller for Aldebaran NAO robot and Simspark robot is totally different, and main plug_in should handle the using of proper controller for each of them.
update.title: Modeling of simspark NAO robot and its Controller

content.raw: There is a repository of Robocup teams binary, It is possible to download UTAsutin binary that can be found in this [link](http://chaosscripting.net/files/competitions/RoboCup/WorldCup/2015/3DSim/binaries/), then run RoboCup_Penalty_kicker.sh, in the beginning the robot will fall, probably the speed of their skill is not adapted to this simulator, I will check it. I am also trying to clean the my agent code and upload it to my fork then it is possible to compile it.
content.html: There is a repository of Robocup teams binary, It is possible to download UTAsutin binary that can be found in this link, then run RoboCup_Penalty_kicker.sh, in the beginning the robot will fall, probably the speed of their skill is not adapted to this simulator, I will check it. I am also trying to clean the my agent code and upload it to my fork then it is possible to compile it.

content.raw:
In order to link I had to remove some of the hardcoded libraries in src/CMakeLists.txt (libgazebo_physics_dart.so, libgazebo_physics_simbody.so, and libgazebo_player.so). We shouldn't have these libraries hardcoded, it will be difficult to maintain. We should use cmake and GAZEBO_LIBRARIES.

When running, I see a segfault. This is the backtrace:

    file=file@entry=0x7fffac0a4a30 "/usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp", line=line@entry=653,

pull_request.title: Modeling of simspark NAO robot and its Controller

pullrequest.title: Modeling of simspark NAO robot and its Controller

content.raw: I added new model with the name of nao_simsperk_dynamics.sdf. In this model, the inertia parts of  nao_type_0.sdf have been recalculated using the geometry information which can be found in this [link](http://simspark.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Models). After testing, I found that keeping the balance of this model is more difficult than the previous one, so because of that I kept the  nao_type_0.sdf, which the kinematics and joints configuration are the same as Simspark NAO model. I think  nao_type_0.sdf is more realistic and more stable.
content.html: I added new model with the name of nao_simsperk_dynamics.sdf. In this model, the inertia parts of nao_type_0.sdf have been recalculated using the geometry information which can be found in this link. After testing, I found that keeping the balance of this model is more difficult than the previous one, so because of that I kept the nao_type_0.sdf, which the kinematics and joints configuration are the same as Simspark NAO model. I think nao_type_0.sdf is more realistic and more stable.

pull_request.title: Modeling of simspark NAO robot and its Controller

update.description:
Here, the simspark NAO model (Type Zero) and its controller are ready. This pull request suggests that this model is merged with the rest of the codes. It uses the PID controller and simulator controls robots joints position based on RoboCup agents commands (Target joints Velocity). I could walk this robot with very low speed. The specification of this model can be found in this [link](http://simspark.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Models).
It should be noted that it is better to use the recent developed agent class that has been implemented for issue #9. I suggest to have a position control for Aldebaran NAO, which I have already implemented that in fc620a7. The controller for Aldebaran NAO robot and Simspark robot is totally different, and main plug_in should handle the using of proper controller for each of them.
update.title: Modeling of simspark NAO robot and its Controller

content.raw: Yes this is one option, however, I think the best way is that the agent determines which model to use by using scene commands.
content.html: Yes this is one option, however, I think the best way is that the agent determines which model to use by using scene commands.

pullrequest.title: Modeling of simspark NAO robot and its Controller

content.raw: Aldebaran Nao and simspark Nao have totally different heights. It better to beam the robot a little bit above the ground in order to avoid the collision of feet and the ground. If robots heights assigned correctly, the constant value of 0.05 or 0.04 should be the same for all robot types.
content.html: Aldebaran Nao and simspark Nao have totally different heights. It better to beam the robot a little bit above the ground in order to avoid the collision of feet and the ground. If robots heights assigned correctly, the constant value of 0.05 or 0.04 should be the same for all robot types.

content.raw:
Hi Carlos, 
After installing this branch and running the gazebo with robocup3d.world, It is possible to run the agent binary that uploaded  in this[ link ](https://feupload.fe.up.pt/get/FXnIMIMKP3af4ru) using the following command:

```
#!shell

./testAgent -u 7
```
Then, an agent with number 7 will be initialized and will perform basic movements and walking. The agents movements are not still very stable.
content.html:
Hi Carlos, After installing this branch and running the gazebo with robocup3d.world, It is possible to run the agent binary that uploaded in this link using the following command:

./testAgent -u 7

Then, an agent with number 7 will be initialized and will perform basic movements and walking. The agents movements are not still very stable.

content.raw:
In Jliang_Nima_Integration branch you can fix the issue by the following lines in the World:


```
#!c++
   <physics type="ode">
      <max_step_size>0.0005</max_step_size>
    </physics>

```
I have laptop, here running 11 vs 11 is very slow, if you compare it with Simspark I think after changing the mentioned line the Simspark is 3 times faster than our simulator. I think ODE has other characteristics, to boost its numerical calculation, multi threading and others. Here I don't know how we can modify those values.
content.html:
In Jliang_Nima_Integration branch you can fix the issue by the following lines in the World:

   <physics type="ode">
      <max_step_size>0.0005</max_step_size>
    </physics>

I have laptop, here running 11 vs 11 is very slow, if you compare it with Simspark I think after changing the mentioned line the Simspark is 3 times faster than our simulator. I think ODE has other characteristics, to boost its numerical calculation, multi threading and others. Here I don't know how we can modify those values.

content.raw: I need the ODE step size to be 0.0005, I could not control the dynamics of the robot with larger ODE step size, but I dont know why after set the ODE step to that value, the simulator in JLinag_Nima_INtegration branch run too slow. In Nima_Integration_branch the simulator runs mush faster.
content.html: I need the ODE step size to be 0.0005, I could not control the dynamics of the robot with larger ODE step size, but I dont know why after set the ODE step to that value, the simulator in JLinag_Nima_INtegration branch run too slow. In Nima_Integration_branch the simulator runs mush faster.

pull_request.title: Modeling of simspark NAO robot and its Controller

pullrequest.title: Modeling of simspark NAO robot and its Controller

content.raw: set the ODE step in world to 0.0005, the server will not crashed. but we should debug why the simulator is too slow now, or find the other way that ODE works faster, I know in simspark they use multi thread ODE. I think we need some help to tune the ODE, to run precisely and fast. In my computer,  in Nima_integration branch the simulator runs similar to real_time, but 11 player vs 11 is very slow.
content.html: set the ODE step in world to 0.0005, the server will not crashed. but we should debug why the simulator is too slow now, or find the other way that ODE works faster, I know in simspark they use multi thread ODE. I think we need some help to tune the ODE, to run precisely and fast. In my computer, in Nima_integration branch the simulator runs similar to real_time, but 11 player vs 11 is very slow.

Here, the simspark NAO model (Type Zero) and its controller is ready. This pull request suggest that this model to be merged with the rest of the code. It uses the PID controller and simulator controls robots joints position based on RoboCup agents commands (Target joints Velocity). I could walk this robot model with very low speed. The specification of this model can be found in this [link](http://simspark.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Models).
It should be noted that it is better to use the recent developed agent class that is implemented for issue #9. I suggest to have a position control for Aldebaran NAO, which I have already implemented that in fc620a7. The controller for Aldebaran NAO robot and and Simspark robot is totally different, and main plug_in should handle to use the proper controller for each of them.
